These cytokines can be divided into three subgroups : TGF-beta , the activins / inhibins , and the bone morphogenetic proteins ( BMPs ) , of which the latter constitute the largest family .
BMPs are 30-38 kDa hetero - or homodimeric proteins originally identified by their ability to induce ectopic cartilage and bone formation [ 2 , 3 ] .
BMPs are 30-38 kDa hetero - or homodimeric proteins originally identified by their ability to induce ectopic cartilage and bone formation [ 2 , 3 ] .
